The pure class interface. 
public abstract class Impure
This class provides system depend functionality, not supported by "100% pure Java". This stuff has become obsolte since JDK 1.2 and ZETA 1.5, but is still here for pure laziness.

lastModified
public abstract Date lastModified(File file);
Check the real modification date of a file.

The standard method File.lastModified does unfortunately only return a system dependend long value, which is not guaranteed to be convertible to a date.

See also:
lastModified

catchInterrupts

public abstract void catchInterrupts();
Configure the running JVM to catch process interrupts (SIGINT).

The standard API seem not to provide a way for doing so.

readAndClearInterrupts

public abstract int readAndClearInterrupts();
Read and clear the number of process interrupts catched so far.

Since there is most likely no portable way to do any Java operation from within a signal handler, interrupts can be recognized by the application only by polling with this method.

runInterruptable

public boolean runInterruptable(Runnable runnable);
A generic implementation for running an interruptable operation. Runs the given runnable. If a process interrupt occures, execution of the runnable will be terminated, and the method returns false, otherwise true.

The runnable may implement non-interrruptable critical sections by synchronizing on itself. Interruption does only occures if a lock can be obtained for the runnable.

By default, this method is implemented by a daemon which polls with method readAndClearProcessInterrupts in regular time intervalls (approx. 100ms). For some systems the method may provide an implementation not based on polling.
